newsitem.title: CANADA: Videotron sells TQS to Quebecor.
newsitem.headline: Videotron sells TQS to Quebecor.

text.p: Groupe Videotron Ltee said on Friday that it agreed to sell the French-language Quatre Saisons (TQS) television network to a consortium controlled by Quebecor Inc.

The consortium includes the important participation of Canadian Satellite Communications Inc (CANCOM), a unit of WIC Western International Communications Inc. The value of the transaction was not disclosed.
TQS operates the television station licenses of CFJP-TV in Montreal, CFAP-TV in Quebec City, the CJPC-TV in Rimouski and the TQS network license.

The agreement is subject to the approval of the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC). Quebecor and Cancom are committed to the timetable set forth in the CRTC decision 97-84 and to file an application for the transfer of control of the TQS licenses no later than April 29.
